headline: Why Robinhood (HOOD) Stock Is Down Today
summary: Shares of financial services company Robinhood (NASDAQ:HOOD) fell 8.7% in the afternoon session after stocks pulled back (Nasdaq -2.0%, S&P 500 -1.5%) amid fresh concerns about trade tariffs. The pullback followed comments from President Trump clarifying the scope of his administration's 25% tariffs on Venezuela. He noted that it would apply to any country that does business with Venezuela. For example, 25% is on top of the already-in-place 20% tariff on China because China imports oil from Vene

headline: Robinhood to bring wealth management, private banking to retail investors
summary: Robinhood is rolling outwealth management and private banking services for investorswith modest portfolios, as the trading platform looks to have abigger influence on its users' financial habits. ...

headline: Robinhood: Long-Term Potential, Short-Term Pain
summary: Robinhood saw strong growth in 2024 but faced a 46% stock decline. Read why HOOD has significant short-term downside potential.
